title: Daughter given 'ugliest ring ever' after mum gifts her old engagement jewellery
text:

A daughter being handed her mum's old engagement ring when she turns 18 seems like it should be sweet gesture.

It didn't turn out that way for one woman, who immediately posted a photo of the ring her mum had kindly gifted her on a Facebook group called 'That's It, I'm Ring Shaming'.

The very unusual piece dating back to the 80s shows a thick, gold band with a diamond mounted high above it, which the unidentified poster from Washington dubbed the 'sweater destroyer'.

Unfortunately for her parents, that was about as kind as the feedback got as others piled in with their own savage opinions, as reported by the Daily Mail .

"It's so nice of your mom to love your dad through the decision to buy this ring for her," said one. "She's so brave."

Another commenter said more bluntly: "Does your dad hate your mom?"

People were also quick to point out the ring's uncanny resemblance to a doorknob and simply couldn't hold back their sheer hatred for the jewellery.

One wrote: "Ding ding ding we have a winner. This might just be the most horrid ring I have ever seen.

Another added: "I'm really sorry to be mean but this is it. Probably officially the ugliest ring."

A third said: "At least it doubles as a mirror so she can look at herself and re-evaluate her choices."

It's not the first or last time a ring has been shamed online, which a poor bride found out recently when she posted about her fondness for her family heirloom engagement ring .

It didn't take long for the sentimental piece of to be posted in the same group, where it was compared first to a 'squirt of mayonnaise' then to 'semen'.

Ouch.
description: The unusual engagement ring fell victim to savage put-downs online where it was compared to a doorknob
